title: Zune corporate face / Momo racing logo - Endurance, ??? {Bram P, ???}
content:
Looking for a Id from the Zune site and Momo racing.

Thx

[www.zune.net](http://web.archive.org/web/20110228235257/http:/www.zune.net/ "www.zune.net")

[www.momo.it/](http://web.archive.org/web/20110228235257/http:/www.momo.it/ "www.momo.it/")

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [Picture 1.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20110228235257/http:/typophile.com/files/Picture%201_19.jpg) | 43.88 KB |
| [Picture 2.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20110228235257/http:/typophile.com/files/Picture%202_1.jpg) | 9.37 KB |
author: typevolcom

comments.content:
1 - helvetica light (free your inner dj)  
2 - looks like a modification of a pixel font... but i'm not quite sure.

Didn't Zune used [Endurance](http://web.archive.org/web/20110228235257/http:/www.ascendercorp.com/portfolio_custom.html#Zune) in their packaging and printed materials?

The sample looked just like Helvetica, though, I guess we need to see the _a_ to really know what it is :)

Thanks for all the feedback here is a picture of the a

I thought the helevetica light looked a little thick to match

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20110228235257im_/http:/typophile.com/files/a_5096.jpg)
That is definitely Endurance. Helvetica has horizontal terminals, it didn’t need the a to see that. BTW: if you’re looking for a refreshing alternative to H, check out Akkurat on Lineto.
